That's the problem that affected the old Bobcat's ISS, it used ksp standard solar tracking and even if you could attach the radiators they wouldn't move togheter with the panels
Yesterday I tested the Dreamchaser in Stock but it is too top-heavy. Gliding is non functional. It dropped like a stone.
It seems too square, it seems kinda squat, the cockpit seems a bit long, the cargo bay is kinda unnecessary, and the rear wheels are much too small. I know its a lot, but it just feels wrong to me.

ok I will se what I can do... all I did was put on the wing flaps really...

- - - Updated - - -

in other news. I think my station is too low...

awwwwwwwwww
Uh...yeah...maybe a,few,hund meters too low!

ok I will se what I can do... all I did was put on the wing flaps really...

http://i.imgur.com/coDkqwV.png

Do you think you can also edit the IR groups for the Canadarm2 in the iss craft file??
I dont know if you can add groups to the configs but I can have a look see.
Inspiring video made by frostsid. Amazing work!

I've been using this mod and your space shuttle mod for quite a while now and have to say they're epic! I don't know how you find time to develop these things and still play the game but your work nonetheless is much appreciated! If i could request one thing however, please don't scrap the cargo bay for the Dreamchaser as it's vital for my extended duration flights due to the options of TAC lifesupport and additional fuel. Also, i don't know if its been fixed in the latest version (about to update it), but when the Dreamchaser's vertical control surface is used it seems to cause the little patches attached to it to clip through the craft. Don't know if it's a bug or working as intended and sorry if i didn't explain it properly.

I've been using this mod and your space shuttle mod for quite a while now and have to say they're epic! I don't know how you find time to develop these things and still play the game but your work nonetheless is much appreciated! If i could request one thing however, please don't scrap the cargo bay for the Dreamchaser as it's vital for my extended duration flights due to the options of TAC lifesupport and additional fuel. Also, i don't know if its been fixed in the latest version (about to update it), but when the Dreamchaser's vertical control surface is used it seems to cause the little patches attached to it to clip through the craft. Don't know if it's a bug or working as intended and sorry if i didn't explain it properly.

Thanks for telling me about the clipping issue. Will fix

And I wish I had time to play the game more.... I usually find problems to fix through feedback from others.
The Dreamchaser thing seems to be that the control surfaces attached to the center tail rotate in the vertical axis, rather than the lateral axis (i.e. they should "pop up" like spoilers).

The Dreamchaser thing seems to be that the control surfaces attached to the center tail rotate in the vertical axis, rather than the lateral axis (i.e. they should "pop up" like spoilers).

Yes, like they used to. They are air brakes right. Unity editor export issue. Will fix like I sorted the shuttle tail.
Anyone having issues getting the american pack to fly straight

Another issue I've run into is the bounding box for the ISS. Last time I tried to dock something (a Progress to the end of Zarya), MechJeb gave me a ship size of over 600m. When I had it show the bounding boxes, the one for the ISS was enormous!

I'll try again tomorrow, and if it persists, I'll post a screenshot.
Um...shouldn't you be docking to the end of the Zvesda?

Probably. It's whichever was the second Russian module...

Anyway...

I saw something reflecting sunlight (Kerbolight?) on approach, but damned if I can find it. It's gotta be at the other corner of that big blue bounding box...

It thinks there's something attached to the station that's 550m or so in size. The problem is, there's nothing that big attached.
Will the dreamchaser have a 1.25m node on the back? Or a .625?
Hey, Mike, when you get a chance, if you haven't gotten there yet, could you make an ESP storage unit for the ISS. It is needed because they hold the station's ORUs.
Apparently, my problem is the JEM arm. Once I undocked the JEM pressurized module, the bounding box reverted to normal.
